title: Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

vocab.definition: Study of rates of enzyme-catalyzed reactions and factors affecting them
Control of enzyme activity through binding at sites other than active site
Process by which cells detect, process, and respond to external stimuli
Process by which genetic information is used to synthesize functional products
Study of heritable changes in gene expression without DNA sequence changes

teachingNotes: Examine regulatory mechanisms and complex cellular processes. Discuss how molecular interactions control life functions.

sample.question: What is the study of enzyme-catalyzed reaction rates?

truefalse.question: Allosteric regulation controls enzymes through non-active site binding.

multiplechoice.question: What process allows cells to detect and respond to stimuli?

fillintheblank.question: Heritable changes in gene expression without DNA changes define ________.

shortanswer.question: How does gene expression control cellular function?
